      • StringInputInRange

        public static int StringInputInRange​(int min,
                                     int max)
        Check if user input is within an inclusive range of numbers

        Used to prevent InputMisMatchException.

        Parameters:
        min - the mininum inclusive range
        max - the maximum inclusive range
        Returns:
        the Integer value of user's input, return -1 if out of range

      • simulation

        public static void simulation​(int totalBattles,
                              int myLevel,
                              int oppLevel,
                              boolean equip,
                              int rarity)
        Simulate Character battling against a Monster

        Statistics to print: total battles, wins, losses, rounds (two-way attack, if possible), average round/battle, and win percentage.

        Entities will not gain experience through battles; Equipments will lose durability accordingly (see: Player.equipmentUsed(); HP are only restored if Entity faints

        Parameters:
        battles - the number of battles to simulation (a battle lasts until an Entity faints)
        mylevel - the level to set Character at
        oppLevel - the level to set Entity at
        equip - true to fullEquip() Player, else false
        rarity - the rarity to set equipments at (1~7 inclusive)
